document.title: Prime Ideals in Semigroups
document.abstract: The concept of prime ideal, which arises in the theory of rings as a generalization of the concept of prime number in the ring of integers, plays a highly important role in that theory, as might be expected from the central position occupied by the primes in arithmetic. In the present paper, the concept is defined for ideals in semigroups, the simplest of the algebraic systems of single composition, and some analogies and differences between the ring and semigroup theories are brought out. We make only occasional references to ring theory, however; a reader acquainted with that theory will perceive its relation to our theorems without difficulty, and a reader unacquainted with it will find that the logical development of our results is entirely independent of it.
